sentence: In her race for the Senate, Barnette calls her three fellow Republicans who recently moved into the state to run – Dave McCormick, Carla Sands and Mehmet Oz – "carpetbaggers," and then she adds, "We don't need to send another rich person to D.C. to represent our interests.
title: Kathy Barnette Hopes To Become US Senate's First Black Republican Woman

sentence: Watch us stand up to Joe Biden below: #PASen https://t.co/vMqEcQEAqX — Dave McCormick (@DaveMcCormickPA) February 14, 2022
author: Valerie Richardson
title: ‘Let’s Go, Brandon’ ad airs during Super Bowl in Pennsylvania

sentence: — Holly Otterbein (@hollyotterbein) February 17, 2022 POLITICO's Holly Otterbein tweeted on Thursday that Senatorial candidate Dave McCormick pulled out of a GOP debate for Monday, February 21, after he learned Dr. Mehmet Oz would not be attending.
author: Rebecca Downs
title: Out of State Candidates Refuse to Show Up for Senate GOP Debate in Key Battleground State

sentence: Among his top rivals in the GOP Senate primary are Mehmet Oz, the well-known celebrity physician, cardiac surgeon, author and former longtime host of TV’s popular "Dr. Oz Show;" Dave McCormick, a former hedge fund executive, West Point graduate and Gulf War combat veteran who served as a Treasury Department official in former President George W. Bush's administration; Carla Sands, a real estate executive and major Republican donor who served as ambassador to Denmark under former President Donald Trump; and veteran and conservative political commentator Kathy Barnette.
author: Paul Steinhauser
title: Pennsylvania Senate clash: Bartos showcases ‘strongest grassroots army’ in GOP primary race

sentence: (WHTM) – A new Fox News poll shows former hedge fund CEO Dave McCormick taking a nine point lead in the race to represent Pennsylvania in the United States Senate.
author: George Stockburger
title: McCormick, Oz lead Fox News Poll of Pa. Senate race

sentence: Kathy Barnette, Jeff Bartos, Dave McCormick, Mehmet Oz, and Carla Sands will appear in the Pennsylvania Republican U.S. Senate debate on April 25 at 8 p.m. in a one-hour prime-time event airing in every market in the commonwealth.

title: Pennsylvania Senate Race Debate: Republican candidates face-off
